job_description:
Adform focuses on an exploration of a vast amount of online advertising data, development of predictive and segmentation models to optimize campaign strategy towards the most meaningful inventory, audience and ad, fraud detection, and many others. You will be a vital part of the data scientist efforts, working in a cross-functional international Agile team, with other data scientists, engineers, product managers, and leaders located in multiple locations around the world. If you are hands-on passionate, crazy about a development of advanced algorithms, machine learning, statistics, Hadoop, Python and SQL, have an ownership mindset, love to work in teams with smart, informal and open people, we’d love to get to know you! 

Our focus is Big Data, High Load and challenging experiences with understanding and taking advantage from data in Ad-Tech industry.
 


We hope you are ready to change the game! Be ready to:

Apply advanced machine learning/statistical algorithms scalable to huge data sets to: 
Determine the most meaningful ad, served to the right user at the optimal time, and the best price 
Identify behaviours, interests and segments of web users across billions of transactions to find the most optimal audience for a given advertising activity 
Eliminate suspicious / non-human traffic 
Maintenance our products, support customers in analysing the reasons behind the decisions made by our algorithms and look for new improvements in the process of striving for their excellence 
Work closely with other Data Scientists, development, and product teams to implement algorithms into production-level software. Mentor less experienced colleagues. 
Contribute to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions 
Be an active technical challenger in the team for the purpose of mutual improvement and broadening of team and company horizons 
Design solutions and lead cross-functional technical projects from ideation to deployment 


Attitude First. Everything else will follow. We can grow together faster if you have:

Minimum 1 year work experience in a similar senior position. Minimum 6 years experience in Data Science in total. 
Masters or PhD in a quantitative field such as Machine Learning, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics or related. 
Excellent mathematical and statistical skills (statistical inference), experience in working with large datasets. Knowledge of data pipelines, ETL processes. 
Very good knowledge of multiply supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques with math background and hands-on experience 
Great problem-solving and analytical skills. 
Ability to structure a large business problem into tractable and reasonable components, design and deploy scalable machine learning solutions 
Proficiency in Python, SQL 
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hadoop)
Adform‘s guiding principles ingrained in your profile: Focus on Client Value, Behave with Decency, Take Ownership, Care, Collaborateas a TeamPlayer, Remain Ambitious, and StandTall inall interactions 


Stand out by having:

Knowledge of Ad Tech industry solutions 
Knowledge of web technologies 


Our promise to you:

You will be a vital part of the data scientist efforts, working in a cross-functional international Agile team, with other data scientists, engineers, product managers, and leaders located in multiple locations around the world. 
A dynamic, inspiring, and international environment filled with ambitious and caring colleagues
Premium health insurance with ₹10,00,000 coverage for you and your family
24 paid vacation days to enjoy life outside of work
Paid maternity (6 months) and paternity (2 weeks)
Annual learning budget to help you grow your skills and support continuous learning
Rewarding referral program for helping us grow
Global perks such as birthday gifts, work anniversaries, and company events to connect with colleagues and have fun
And much more – join us to explore the full experience


Diversity s Inclusion @Adform:

Adform is an equal opportunity employer with a global perspective. We remain committed to creating an environment that not only respects different backgrounds but celebrates them too. We believe that diversity in all its forms enhances our teams’ creativity, innovation, and effectiveness, and therefore we value different backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.
We are committed to creating a work environment where Adform employees feel valued for who they are and what they can contribute, free from any type of discrimination.

profile_data.headline: Jr. Machine Learning Engineer
profile_data.about:
Welcome to my world of AI-driven innovation and creativity!

As a Computer Science and Engineering graduate with a passion for Artificial Intelligence since 2017, I bring a fresh perspective to the dynamic world of technology. My journey began with a fascination for AI's potential to transform the way we interact with machines, and it quickly led me to specialize in Natural Language Processing and Generative AI.

Being a firm believer that communication is the key to success, I pride myself on my exceptional English communication skills, enabling me to bridge the gap between complex AI concepts and everyday conversations. I find joy in breaking down intricate technical jargon into accessible knowledge for everyone.

The ever-evolving landscape of artificial intelligence captivates me, and I am determined to be an active participant in its unfolding story. Staying up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI is not just a habit; it's a passion that drives me to explore, experiment, and share my insights with the world.

Driven by a relentless pursuit of excellence, I approach every project with a result-oriented mindset. The thirst for knowledge and a hunger to learn new things quickly propels me forward, fueling my desire to make a meaningful impact in the AI domain.

When it comes to turning ideas into reality, I wield the power of Python programming and leverage data science libraries to create AI solutions that go beyond the ordinary. My technical proficiency and problem-solving skills empower me to take on challenges with confidence and innovation.

With boundless curiosity and a commitment to excellence, I am eager to forge ahead in the realm of Artificial Intelligence, making significant contributions that shape the future. Join me on this exciting journey as we push the boundaries of what AI can achieve and unlock the full potential of this remarkable technology together.

Let's embark on a transformative AI adventure – one where creativity, dedication, and limitless possibilities converge. Together, we will shape the future of AI and create a world where intelligent machines revolutionize our lives for the better.

description.text:
Immersed in cutting-edge technologies, I gained substantial knowledge and practical experience in generative AI, system design, and integration of complex APIs. Enhanced my technical prowess using Docker and AWS to develop scalable solutions in a dynamic start-up environment.

Spearheaded the development of an innovative application designed to optimize resumes for ATS compatibility. This tool automatically analyzes resumes, identifies deficiencies, queries users to fill gaps, and reformats the information into an enhanced, ATS-friendly format, significantly boosting job seekers' chances of landing interviews.

Created a smart, adaptive question-answering system tailored for major standardized tests including IELTS, TOEFL, GMAT, and GRE. The system evaluates user responses, pinpoints errors, and generates personalized reports offering detailed insights and strategies for improving both topic-specific skills and overall exam performance.

• Engaged in an intensive training program focusing on Java and SQL, gaining foundational knowledge and expertise in both areas.
• Successfully completed monthly milestone tests with 82 %, demonstrating consistent growth and understanding of key concepts.
• Collaborated with a diverse team of interns, sharing insights and learning from collective experiences
• Demonstrated commitment and adaptability by quickly adjusting to the dynamic learning environment and meeting all set milestones.
Abdul R  IGNITE Training Completion Certificate.pdf

Drips Monitoring Stress Detection System for Patients 
• Developed a system to monitor patient drip levels via ultrasonic sensors; alarms are activated once thresholds are met, promptly notifying nursing staff, reducing the time spent by 80%.
• Seamlessly integrated an EDA sensor with NodeMCU to gauge patient stress levels in real-time.
• Achieved continuous data updates to ThingSpeak cloud, ensuring immediate access and monitoring capabilities for medical professionals.

keywords: The user's input "hey" is too vague to perform keyword extraction or gap analysis.  Please provide a specific question about keywords, such as "Extract keywords from the job description" or "Compare my profile to the job description and highlight missing keywords".

messages.ai_response: Hello! How can I assist you with optimizing your LinkedIn profile today?

messages.user_query: Improve my profile so I can apply for Data Scientist role
messages.ai_response:
To strengthen your LinkedIn profile for Data Scientist applications, focus on these key areas:

**Headline:**  Update your headline to reflect your skills and aspirations.  Consider options like "Data Scientist | Machine Learning Engineer | NLP Expertise" or "Aspiring Data Scientist | Building AI Solutions with Python & NLP," incorporating keywords like Big Data, Machine Learning, and SQL (identified as critical keywords).

**Experience Section:**  Transform your experience descriptions into achievement-oriented bullet points. Quantify your accomplishments using numbers whenever possible. For example, instead of "Enhanced my technical prowess," write "Developed and deployed a resume optimization tool resulting in a 20% increase in interview requests."  Clearly state the technologies used (including Python, SQL, and any Big Data tools like Spark or Hadoop, as mentioned in relevant job descriptions) and the impact achieved for each project.  Highlight your 6 years of total experience and your 1 year as a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, emphasizing accomplishments related to keywords such as Predictive Modeling, Segmentation Models, and ETL Processes.

**Skills Section:**  Prioritize skills like Data Analysis, Data Modeling, and Data Manipulation at the top. Add or move up critical skills such as SQL, specific machine learning algorithms (e.g., Regression, Classification), and big data technologies (e.g., Spark, Hadoop). Remove less relevant skills.

**About Section:** Condense your "About" section to a concise (3-4 sentence) summary highlighting your key skills and quantifiable achievements. Include a call to action, such as "Let's connect to discuss how my skills can benefit your team."

**Recommendations:**  Solicit recommendations from previous managers or clients who can attest to your data science skills and accomplishments.


Remember to emphasize keywords like Statistical Algorithms, Python, SQL, Hadoop (critical), and Predictive Modeling, Fraud Detection, and Data Pipelines (important) throughout your profile to improve its visibility to recruiters.

messages.user_query: I wanna becom a data scientist suggest me stuff to learn based on my role
messages.ai_response:
To become a data scientist and successfully apply for roles like the Adform Data Scientist position, focusing on these key areas will significantly strengthen your application:

**High-Priority Skill Development (Months 1-3):**

* **Big Data Technologies (Spark & Hadoop):**  Your existing data pipeline experience provides a good foundation.  However, hands-on experience with Spark and Hadoop is crucial.  Consider the Coursera or edX course, "Spark and Hadoop for Big Data with Python," aiming for completion within 3 months.  Focus on practical application and projects using large datasets (e.g., from Kaggle).

* **Advanced Machine Learning Algorithms for Large Datasets:** While you possess foundational machine learning skills, the Adform role requires expertise in advanced techniques (deep learning, ensemble methods) applied to large datasets.  The Coursera "Machine Learning Specialization" (Andrew Ng) is a recommended resource, focusing on algorithms relevant to AdTech (recommendation systems, fraud detection). Aim to complete this within 3 months.

* **Advanced SQL & Data Manipulation:**  Enhance your SQL skills, focusing on efficient querying and data manipulation for large datasets. DataCamp's "SQL for Data Science" course is a structured option (aim for 2 months completion).

**Intermediate Skill Development (Months 4-6):**

* **ETL Processes & Data Pipelines:** Develop proficiency in building robust and scalable data pipelines.  Udemy (or similar platforms) offer courses on "Data Engineering with Python," focusing on tools like Apache Airflow or Prefect (2 months).  Build a project demonstrating this skill.

**Advanced Preparation & Application (Months 7-12):**

* **AdTech Domain Knowledge:**  Gain familiarity with the AdTech industry's unique challenges and data structures.  Explore resources like AdExchanger, Digiday, and relevant online communities (Reddit's r/adtech, LinkedIn groups).  Consider relevant certifications (e.g., Google Analytics Individual Qualification).  Networking with AdTech professionals is highly beneficial.

**Project Portfolio:**

Build a portfolio showcasing your skills.  Start with a project using a large, publicly available dataset (e.g., Kaggle) involving data cleaning, transformation, EDA, and basic model building using Spark/Hadoop (Phase 1).  Next, create a project focusing on building an ETL pipeline for a moderately sized dataset and applying an advanced machine learning model (Phase 2).  Document your work and host your code on GitHub.

**Addressing the Experience Gap:**  The Adform role requires 6 years of experience, while you have 1.  This roadmap focuses on rapidly acquiring the necessary skills and building a strong portfolio to compensate for the experience gap.  Actively apply for roles starting at month 9, highlighting your new skills and projects.  Tailor your resume and LinkedIn profile to emphasize your accomplishments.  Remember to continuously update your LinkedIn profile to reflect your progress.

messages.user_query: just list them please so I can find or do courses
messages.ai_response:
• **Spark & Hadoop for Big Data Processing:**  "Apache Spark and Hadoop Fundamentals" (Udemy, 40 hours, Beginner)  "Big Data Fundamentals with Spark and Hadoop" (Coursera, 6 weeks, Beginner/Intermediate)

• **Advanced Machine Learning Algorithms:** "Machine Learning Specialization" (Coursera, Andrew Ng, 3 months, Intermediate/Advanced)  "Advanced Machine Learning with TensorFlow" (Udacity, 3 months, Intermediate/Advanced)

• **Statistical Inference and Modeling:** "Statistical Inference and Modeling for Data Science" (edX, 8 weeks, Intermediate) "Causal Inference" (Coursera, 6 weeks, Intermediate/Advanced)

• **ETL Processes and Data Pipelines:** "Data Engineering with Python and Spark" (DataCamp, 20 hours, Intermediate)  "Building Data Pipelines with Apache Airflow" (Udemy, 30 hours, Intermediate)

• **SQL for Data Analysis:** "SQL for Data Science" (DataCamp, 15 hours, Beginner/Intermediate) "Advanced SQL: A Deep Dive" (Udemy, 20 hours, Intermediate)

messages.user_query: just based on my current profile tell me how to become a cto
messages.ai_response:
Based on your current LinkedIn profile as a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, becoming a CTO requires a substantial shift in focus and significant experience acquisition.  Your current skills in Python, SQL, API development, and data analysis are valuable, but a CTO role demands broader expertise in leadership, architecture, and strategic technology planning.  The following steps outline a path, acknowledging the considerable experience gap:

**LinkedIn Profile Optimization:**

*   **Headline:** Update your headline to reflect leadership aspirations (e.g., "Aspiring CTO | AI/ML Engineer Driving Innovation").
*   **Experience:** Reframe your experience to emphasize strategic impact and leadership, quantifying achievements with results (e.g., "Reduced development time by 15%").  Include details on project management, team collaboration, and strategic decision-making.
*   **Skills:** Add skills crucial for CTO roles: Software Architecture, Cloud Infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP), IT Strategy, Budget Management, Team Leadership, Project Management (Agile, Waterfall). Prioritize these over your current data science skills.
*   **About Section:**  Rewrite to highlight leadership potential, strategic thinking, problem-solving abilities, and experience (even small-scale) managing budgets or teams.
*   **Projects:** Add projects showcasing leadership or involvement in system design/architecture.  If lacking, actively seek such projects.


**Skill Development Roadmap:**  This roadmap focuses first on achieving a senior Data Scientist role, a crucial stepping stone to a CTO position.  It addresses the significant experience gap (currently 1 year experience vs. a minimum 7 years required for target roles).

**Phase 1 (Months 1-3): Foundation Building**

*   **Advanced Spark & Hadoop:**  Complete a course like "Spark and Python for Big Data with PySpark" on Coursera/Udemy (approx. 3 months). Focus on large-scale data processing.
*   **ETL Processes & Data Pipelines:** Complete a course like "Data Warehousing and ETL" (approx. 2 months).  Focus on practical application and building efficient pipelines.
*   **Project:** Develop an ETL project on a large public dataset (e.g., UCI Machine Learning Repository), demonstrating proficiency in data cleaning, transformation, and loading.

**Phase 2 (Months 4-6): Intermediate Development**

*   **Advanced Machine Learning Algorithms (Scalable):** Complete a course focusing on model scaling and optimization (e.g., Andrew Ng's "Machine Learning Specialization" on Coursera, approx. 3 months).
*   **MLOps Fundamentals:** Complete a course or utilize online tutorials focusing on model deployment, monitoring, and management (approx. 3 months). Explore Docker and Kubernetes.
*   **Project:** Deploy your Phase 1 ETL project to a cloud environment (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) using Docker and a basic CI/CD pipeline.  Add to your GitHub portfolio.

**Phase 3 (Months 7-12): Advanced Preparation & AdTech Focus**

*   **Deep Dive into AdTech:** Utilize online courses, industry blogs (AdExchanger, Marketing Land), conferences, and LinkedIn Learning paths (approx. 6 months).
*   **Industry Networking:** Attend AdTech meetups, engage in online communities, and pursue relevant certifications.
*   **Application:** After 9 months, apply for Data Scientist roles in AdTech, targeting roles with mentorship opportunities.

**Addressing the Experience Gap:**  The significant experience gap is a major hurdle. This roadmap prioritizes rapid skill development and impactful project creation to showcase your abilities.  Targeting roles offering mentorship and highlighting transferable skills during interviews is crucial. Consider freelance or open-source contributions related to AdTech.  This roadmap, while ambitious, provides a structured path; regular self-assessment and adjustments are key.  Remember that networking within the AdTech community is essential.  Becoming a CTO requires considerably more experience and leadership than this roadmap directly addresses; this focuses on achieving a senior Data Scientist role as a stepping stone.
